definition: to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Set the debug option to enable a backtrace when a; problem occurs.
sentences.chinese: 当有问题出现显示错误信息，便于调试。

sentences.english: If you spend any time surfing the Internet, you've probably encountered a few error messages.
sentences.chinese: 在网上浏览时，你可会发现一些错误信息。

sentences.english: In addition, the patient or surrogate may correct any historical misinformation at this time.
sentences.chinese: 病人或代诉者还可在此时纠正病史中的一些错误信息。

sentences.english: Bug with phone is not avaliable in Zune while syncing & phone goes stand by is ALSO FIXED!
sentences.chinese: 同步时，手机进入待机模式，不会有错误信息出现。

sentences.english: A full error message follows, running to the end of the format string.
sentences.chinese: 紧跟一个完整的错误信息，直到格式串尾。

sentences.english: Take care not to be misled by rumours.
Her innocent expression misled me into trusting her.
sentences.chinese: 她天真无邪的表情使得我误信了她。

sentences.english: Stigma and misinformation are rife. Treatment is expensive.
sentences.chinese: 患病倍感羞辱，错误信息盛传，疾病治疗昂贵。

sentences.english: Don't let his friendly manner mislead you into trusting him.
sentences.chinese: 不要让他那种友好的使你误信他。

sentences.english: See attached for information on this error.
sentences.chinese: 见所附有关此错误信息。

sentences.english: Configure the application not to show verbose error messages to remote users.
sentences.chinese: 将应用程序配置为不向远程用户显示详细错误信息。

sentences.english: Government officials must differentiate between transparency and providing uninformed information.
sentences.chinese: 政府官员必须把透明度和提供错误信息区分开来。

sentences.english: This error message will appear when the device is not connected to ActiveSync correctly.
sentences.chinese: 这个错误信息将出现在设备没有正确的连接。

sentences.english: Check for error messages in the lower-right corner.
sentences.chinese: 在右下角检查错误信息。

sentences.english: If there are any error messages, review and correct them now.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何错误信息，可对其进行检查和纠正。

sentences.english: Many users will panic at the error message.
sentences.chinese: 许多用户在出现错误信息时会惊慌。

definition: to listen to information/to get the news/to believe what one hears
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
to take sth to be true
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
